newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Forex volatility fears depresses Manila stocks.
newsitem.headline: Forex volatility fears depresses Manila stocks.

text.p: * Dow Jones fall Friday adds to gloom
Manila stocks fell again at the open on Monday due to fears of another roller-coaster ride in the foreign exchange markets in the region, traders said.
The composite index dipped 32.55 points, or 1.26 percent, to a year-low of 2,543.58.
"This is follow-through selling from Friday's foreign currency scare. A lot of investors are still shivering," said Joey Roxas, president at Eagle Equities.
Brokers said the 138-point drop of the Dow Jones Friday and uncertainties on whether the U.S. Fed will change its rates on Tuesday added to the market's gloom.

Liza Joson, research director at Amsteel Securities, said the market will closely watch the Central Bank's move in the next few days after it increased its overnight borrowing rate by seven-percentage points to 20 percent on Friday.
